Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[README] Improve blockquote styling" (#9083) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Not using metric identifier to get metric object." (#9082) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Fixes an issue introduced by #8906 

The `metricNamespace` specified in the code overridden the one specified in the configuration and we ended up with metrics reported to the wrong location. This change fixes it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Not using metric identifier to get metric object." (#9082) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: The `metricNamespace` specified in the code overridden the one specified in the configuration and we ended up with metrics reported to the wrong location. This change fixes it.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Dapper_Release Notes_ScreenReader: On tab navigation to the link under 'Release Notes' tab, NVDA announces the link as the https reference" (#9061) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468978

**Actual:**
On tab navigation to the link under 'Release Notes' tab, NVDA announces the link as the https reference
Similar issue is also observed in JAWS
Similar issue is observed in through out the application.

**Expected:**
The name of the link should be descriptive it should have a name that tell its destination point

**User Impact:**
Screen readers users will face difficulty if link is not announced descriptively.

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: [https://www.nuget.org/packages/Dapper/](https://nam06.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https:%2f%2fwww.nuget.org%2f&data=04%7c01%7cv-prajadhav%40microsoft.com%7cf2a4ca1fba7e473d451608d9a59e03f4%7c72f988bf86f141af91ab2d7cd011db47%7c1%7c0%7c637722920825871875%7cUnknown%7cTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7c1000&sdata=OWWbKuc497S8l6rMh9v0D4GOq3rSkwlcss0RW8CyFkk%3D&reserved=0)
2. "Dapper" page will get open.
3. Tab to 'Release Notes' tab controls and press enter to select it.
4. Run the NVDA
5. Check that screen reader is announcing the link inside 'Release Notes' tab.

### Expected Behavior

The name of the link should be descriptive it should have a name that tell its destination point

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Microsoft.Identity.Client_ScreenReader:When we tab to the NuGet packages' table and GitHub repositories table the screen reader is not announcing the column headers name when its read the cell data" (#9048) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468943

**Actual:**
When we tab to the NuGet packages' table and GitHub repositories table and move to each cell the column header of the respective cell is not read
Similar issue is also observed in JAWS
Similar issue is observed in throughout the application

**Expected:**
Each cell should be read with its name row column number and the column header name it belongs too.

**User Impact:**
Screen readers users will face difficulty in knowing the column header reference of the cell

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/coverlet.msbuild/
2. "Microsoft.Identity.Client" page will get open.
3. Tab to 'Used by' tab controls and press enter to select it.
4. Tab to 'NuGet packages' table.
5. Run the NVDA
6. tab to the cells of the table   

### Expected Behavior

Each cell should be read with its name row column number and the column header name it belongs too.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_Account_ForgotPassword_Keyboard :Invisible content receives focus when user tries to navigate to send button after 'Email' edit field using tab key." (#9052) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468987

**Actual:**
Invisible content receives focus  when the user tries to navigate to send button after 'Email' edit field using tab key.

**Expected:**
There tab focus from edit field should move to  send button on using tab key, Invisible content should not receive focus.

**User Impact:**
Keyboard users will receive correct focus order 

### Repro Steps

1. Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/account/ForgotPassword
2. "Forgot Password" page will get open.
3. Tab to 'Email' edit field and fill it.
4. Tab to send button and observe it.

### Expected Behavior

There tab focus from edit field should move to send button on using tab key, Invisible content should not receive focus.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A11y_NuGet Service_coverlet.msbuild_Tab Navigation_Keyboard : Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists are navigated using tab key instead of arrow key." (#9068) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Describe the bug

**Source:** https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1468923

**Actual:**
Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists are navigated using tab key instead of arrow key.
On using tab to a "tab" item the focus on next tab key moves to the next item rather then the data under it
Similar issue is observed for the tab list including 'Readme' , 'Dependencies' , 'Used by' and 'Version'.
Similar issue is observed in through out the application.

**Expected:**
Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists should be navigated using arrow key instead of tab key and when focus is on a tab item the tab key focus should go inside the data under that tab item.
arrow keys should be used for navigation between tab items and tab key for the data under the tabs

**User Impact:**
Keyboard users will not be able to access the data under tabs immediately 

### Repro Steps

1.  Launch the application URL: https://www.nuget.org/packages/coverlet.msbuild/
2.  "coverlet.msbuild" page will get open.
3.  Tab to Tab navigation controls.
4.  Tab to Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists and observe it.

### Expected Behavior

Tab items 'Package Manager' , '.NET CLI' , 'PackageReference' etc in the tab lists should be navigated using arrow key instead of tab key and when focus is on a tab item the tab key focus should go inside the data under that tab item.
arrow keys should be used for navigation between tab items and tab key for the data under the tabs

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2022.03.28]RI of dev into main" (#9080) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed issue "The package integrity check failed for almost all Microsoft packages I have tried to install" (#11712) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
This all started about 4 hours ago when I tried to update the Microsoft.Data.SqlClient from 3.0.1 to 4.1.0.  I got the "The package integrity check failed" error, and I began looking for solutions.  Microsoft recommends running the following command "dotnet nuget locals http-cache --clear" from here (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/errors-and-warnings/nu3008).  I did that, and tried again, same error.  I then found the option in my Visual Studio to clear my NuGet cache.  I did that.  That was a mistake.  I then had to re-install all my packages.  Fine, did that, but many started to fail with integrity error.  I don't remember them all now, but I ended up having to copy them from another machine so I could get back up and running.  

Now I'm back to square one.  I want to upgrade Microsoft.Data.SqlClient.  Here is the error...

GET https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/microsoft.data.sqlclient/index.json
  OK https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/microsoft.data.sqlclient/index.json 197ms
  GET https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/microsoft.data.sqlclient/4.1.0/microsoft.data.sqlclient.4.1.0.nupkg
  OK https://api.nuget.org/v3-flatcontainer/microsoft.data.sqlclient/4.1.0/microsoft.data.sqlclient.4.1.0.nupkg 32ms
Package 'Microsoft.Data.SqlClient 4.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': Signature Hash Algorithm: SHA256
Package 'Microsoft.Data.SqlClient 4.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': Timestamp: 1/31/2022 5:36:44 PM

Package 'Microsoft.Data.SqlClient 4.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': Verifying author primary signature's timestamp with timestamping service certificate: 
  Subject Name: CN=Symantec SHA256 TimeStamping Signer - G3, OU=Symantec Trust Network, O=Symantec Corporation, C=US
  SHA1 hash: A9A4121063D71D48E8529A4681DE803E3E7954B0
  SHA256 hash: C474CE76007D02394E0DA5E4DE7C14C680F9E282013CFEF653EF5DB71FDF61F8
  Issued by: CN=Symantec SHA256 TimeStamping CA, OU=Symantec Trust Network, O=Symantec Corporation, C=US
  Valid from: 12/22/2017 7:00:00 PM to 3/22/2029 7:59:59 PM

Package 'Microsoft.Data.SqlClient 4.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': Signature type: Author
Package 'Microsoft.Data.SqlClient 4.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': Verifying the author primary signature with certificate: 
  Subject Name: CN=Microsoft Corporation, O=Microsoft Corporation, L=Redmond, S=Washington, C=US
  SHA1 hash: A6E18D21B507879FC7F9C392A5CE355936E3AD2C
  SHA256 hash: AA12DA22A49BCE7D5C1AE64CC1F3D892F150DA76140F210ABD2CBFFCA2C18A27
  Issued by: CN=DigiCert SHA2 Assured ID Code Signing CA, OU=www.digicert.com, O=DigiCert Inc, C=US
  Valid from: 9/29/2020 8:00:00 PM to 10/5/2023 8:00:00 AM

NU3008: Package 'Microsoft.Data.SqlClient 4.1.0' from source 'https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json': The package integrity check failed.

I'm not sure where to go from here.  Any ideas would be great.  Thanks!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Bug]: Tow packages with different names with the same assembly name - error when install" (#11711) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI, Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### Product Version

VS2019, Nuget 5.x

### Worked before?

Don't know, new behavior

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

Hello everyone,

*Scenario:*

_a) Create a project A with netstandard 2.0, create 2 packages:_
- A.1.0.0.nupkg (based on project A, assembly name A)
- A.singleassembly.1.0.0.nupkg (based on project A, assembly name A, just change package name, add .singleassembly)

_b) Create a project B with NET4.7.2:_
- Reference to A.singleassembly.1.0.0
- Create a package for project B, B.1.0.0.nupkg

_c) Create a project C with NET 4.7.2:_
- Reference to B.1.0.0

**Error:**
- When you reference package B, it gives an error that cannot be installed because it's not compatible with NET472
- When you install this package, it takes all other "external" packages except dependency to "A"

**Expected:**
- Should allow the installation of C, bringing dependency to A

_Workaround:_
- Create a new version of A, A.singleassembly.1.1.0.nupkg
- Remove from feed A.1.1.0.nupkg, allowing only A.1.1.0
- Repeat the steps b) and c) below and it will works

It seems that, when you install a package with dependencies, it tries to match \ understand the assembly name and not only the package name to resolve the dependency. It seems that, besides the fact that feed as 2 different packages, it looks to assembly name to resolve dependencies for "3rd party"


This is an internal request, package A as 2 different packages for the same project because the solution where we have project A, as a postbuild behavior to transform all in one single assembly (ILRepack), and we need to publish this singleassembly, but we need to publish also all individual projects.


Thank you!

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Warning NU5118 packaging RCL with static contents and multi-target frameworks netcoreapp3.1;net5.0" (#10253) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

Trying to package a Razor Class Library that contains static contents, and that multi-targets the frameworks `netcoreapp3.1` and `net5.0`, I receive several NU5118 warnings. I'm using `dotnet pack` command from stable .NET 5 SDK. Building works without warnings, packaging no.

dotnet.exe --version: 5.0.100
VS version: 16.8.0

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a new RCL project with this minimal project file:
```
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk.Razor">

  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFrameworks>netcoreapp3.1;net5.0</TargetFrameworks>
  </PropertyGroup>

</Project>
```

2. Add a `wwwroot` directory with a sample static file inside

3. Try to pack it with `dotnet pack`, or VS UI.

### Logs

```
1>------ Build started: Project: RazorClassLibrary1, Configuration: Debug Any CPU ------
1>RazorClassLibrary1 -> C:\Users\mirko\Desktop\wow\WebApplication1\RazorClassLibrary1\bin\Debug\net5.0\RazorClassLibrary1.dll
1>RazorClassLibrary1 -> C:\Users\mirko\Desktop\wow\WebApplication1\RazorClassLibrary1\bin\Debug\netcoreapp3.1\RazorClassLibrary1.dll
1>C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.100\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\buildCrossTargeting\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(207,5): warning NU5118: File 'C:\Users\mirko\Desktop\wow\WebApplication1\RazorClassLibrary1\wwwroot\background.png' is not added because the package already contains file 'staticwebassets\background.png'
1>C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.100\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\buildCrossTargeting\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(207,5): warning NU5118: File 'C:\Users\mirko\Desktop\wow\WebApplication1\RazorClassLibrary1\obj\Debug\netcoreapp3.1\staticwebassets\msbuild.RazorClassLibrary1.Microsoft.AspNetCore.StaticWebAssets.props' is not added because the package already contains file 'build\Microsoft.AspNetCore.StaticWebAssets.props'
1>C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.100\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\buildCrossTargeting\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(207,5): warning NU5118: File 'C:\Users\mirko\Desktop\wow\WebApplication1\RazorClassLibrary1\obj\Debug\netcoreapp3.1\staticwebassets\msbuild.build.RazorClassLibrary1.props' is not added because the package already contains file 'build\RazorClassLibrary1.props'
1>C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.100\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\buildCrossTargeting\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(207,5): warning NU5118: File 'C:\Users\mirko\Desktop\wow\WebApplication1\RazorClassLibrary1\obj\Debug\netcoreapp3.1\staticwebassets\msbuild.buildMultiTargeting.RazorClassLibrary1.props' is not added because the package already contains file 'buildMultiTargeting\RazorClassLibrary1.props'
1>C:\Program Files\dotnet\sdk\5.0.100\Sdks\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack\buildCrossTargeting\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(207,5): warning NU5118: File 'C:\Users\mirko\Desktop\wow\WebApplication1\RazorClassLibrary1\obj\Debug\netcoreapp3.1\staticwebassets\msbuild.buildTransitive.RazorClassLibrary1.props' is not added because the package already contains file 'buildTransitive\RazorClassLibrary1.props'
1>Successfully created package 'C:\Users\mirko\Desktop\wow\WebApplication1\RazorClassLibrary1\bin\Debug\RazorClassLibrary1.1.0.0.nupkg'.
1>Done building project "RazorClassLibrary1.csproj".
========== Build: 1 succeeded, 0 failed, 0 up-to-date, 0 skipped ==========
```

### Sample Project

[RazorClassLibrary1.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/5520980/RazorClassLibrary1.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]:  Reduce memory allocation while detecting cycles or potential degrades in package versions during restore" (#11614) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe

### Product Version

All NuGet distribution vehicles

### Worked before?

No

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

`ClrHeapAllocationAnalyzers` reported following warnings in NuGet restore code paths.

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.DependencyResolver.Core/Remote/RemoteDependencyWalker.cs#L251-L279

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52756182/155260695-a599ffeb-ca85-45ac-b9dd-42f6e42efad6.png)

This said closures caused `254 MB` of allocations for OrchardCore solution restore scenario. https://github.com/OrchardCMS/OrchardCore/tree/75923732c36d2785cb869affb805f0ff19d1847c

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/52756182/155261278-883bc205-a159-4c8b-933f-c9265be9a553.png)

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Bug]: MsBuild version is not parsed correctly when -MsBuildPath option is passed to nuget.exe restore" (#11689) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

NuGet.exe

### Product Version

nuget.exe

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

NuGet.exe version 4.8.2 and above passes `RestoreBuildInParallel="False" and RestoreUseSkipNonexistentTargets="False"` to `msbuild.exe` only when the tool set version is less than `15.5`

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/60927d634f10ccecb76f0596f3dcfe6a31d97de9/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.CommandLine/MsBuildUtility.cs#L270-L278

`nuget.exe restore` command accepts `-MSBuildPath` option to specify the path of MSBuild to use with the command. This option precedes over `-MSBuildVersion` option. If `-MSBuildPath` is passed, then https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/dev/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.CommandLine/MsBuildUtility.cs#L839 line of code invokes https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/60927d634f10ccecb76f0596f3dcfe6a31d97de9/src/NuGet.Clients/NuGet.CommandLine/MsBuildToolset.cs#L27-L31 constructor but it fails to identify the version of msbuild from the path argument like other constructors. This results in `ParsedVersion` property returning `0.0` default version. Hence `nuget.exe` set `RestoreBuildInParallel="False" and RestoreUseSkipNonexistentTargets="False"` always when `-MsBuildPath` option is passed to the restore command.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedBody:
Related to https://github.com/nuget/home/issues/6872. 

Make the following API support packages.config: 
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/visual-studio-extensibility/nuget-api-in-visual-studio#ivsnugetprojectupdateevents-interface
